ygData.subject: Funny crawler bug?  Perhaps a feature.
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi there, I have an interesting situation on a random crawler right now. Running 1.15, so its all my problem, of course. But I thought I would tell you all,

Subject: Funny crawler bug?  Perhaps a feature.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=90724651; y=Jhipa1WL0UTLcnugMbgDFxqugvKWU7y4VyOdKMWxwnyW
X-Yahoo-Profile: lekash

Hi there,

I have an interesting situation on a random crawler right now.

Running 1.15, so its all my problem, of course.
But I thought I would tell you all, for perhaps the entertainment value.

Essentially, this crawler started to experience -5 return codes from DNS 
lookups.
And so, stopped crawling.

Being the resourceful yet modest fellow I am, I paused it, started a 
checkpoint. 
Annoying, but it often works.

Then, when it reported done, I cleverly clicked resume, just to see what 
might happen.
Kind of wedged there for a while, I went home and to sleep.  Check on it 
in the morning.

So now, this fine crawler is crawling away, and has been all day.
It reports itself as paused, and doesn't log anything to the 
progress-statistics.log.
However, crawl.log continues to grow just fine, as do downloaded arcs.

And the last humor filled thing is that recover.gz seems to march right 
in step.

Not sure if I managed to activate some in progress feature, of creating 
a continuous
recover log, or what the eventual state will be.   But I'll leave it up, 
and see what happens.
Not to mention,  I want the crawl data, and its best to not annoy people 
by too often,
recrawling their site.

John
